newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX oil prices slip off highs, but strength held.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX oil prices slip off highs, but strength held.

text.p: NYMEX crude oil prices began to fall off their midday highs ahead of the close on Wednesday but remained strong despite a lack of volume, players said.
"We ran up to highs in crude earlier today," said one New York floor trader. "But once we got up to those highs the marketstalled. There is a real lack of volume."
At 1414 EST/1914 GMT, May crude was trading 17 cents higher at $21.16 a barrel after hitting a high today of $21.42.
Resistance was pegged at $21.43, the high reached in Monday activity.
